page.title: 031980s LEISURE ACTIVITIES
page.content: A popular leisure time activity in the 1980s is Martial Arts. This is learning to defend yourself if you are attacked. The art is only used for self-defence or to defend the weak. In the club you must wear a white suit with a certain coloured belt which signifies your grade or importance. We do sparring and patterns for different belts or grades. Sparring is where two people put on boxing gloves. You can also wear feet guards and head guards for extra protection. This is to practise defending yourself in case you are in a real fight. A pattern is where one person does a sequence of movements in attack and defence against an imaginary opponent. The club that I attend takes place on Wednesdays and Fridays from 6.00p.m. until 8.00p.m.
